project.teaser: EDITO-Model Lab will prepare the next generation of ocean models, complementary to Copernicus Marine Service to be integrated into the EU public infrastructure of the European Digital Twin Ocean (EDITO) that will ensure access to required input and validation data (from...
project.objective: EDITO-Model Lab will prepare the next generation of ocean models, complementary to Copernicus Marine Service to be integrated into the EU public infrastructure of the European Digital Twin Ocean (EDITO) that will ensure access to required input and validation data (from EMODnet, EuroGOOS, ECMWF, Copernicus Services and Sentinels satellite observations) and to high-performance and distributed computing facilities (from EuroHPC for HPC and other cloud computing resources) and that will be consolidated under developments of Destination Earth (DestinE). The objective is to make ocean knowledge available to citizens, entrepreneurs, policymakers, decision-makers and scientific experts alike, thus enabling them to become partners in knowledge generation, explore desirable futures and develop ocean management scenarios (and assemble their own twins), with the overarching goal of ensuring a safe, healthy and productive ocean. As an interactive and user driven initiative, EDITO-Model Lab will deliver a Virtual Ocean Model Lab (VOML) including (1) a core model suite including global high-resolution models and coastal configurations, (2) downstream user toolkits and (3) a developers toolkit for a sustainable ocean. The VOML will be an interactive and co-development environment to operate models. EDITO core model suite will be based on modelling and simulation software, artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms and specialised tools to form a new service capacity for accessing, manipulating, analysing and understanding marine information. Intermediate and downstream stakeholders will find digital tools, data and information for focus applications (FA) that refer to the Mission Ocean Lighthouses (MOLs) and the sustainable Blue economy, including what-if scenarios to find solutions to natural and man-induced hazards. EDITO-Model Lab will be delivered in 36 months by a consortium of 14 authoritative partners, covering ocean knowledge, modelling and technological expertise.
project.title: Underlying models for the European DIgital Twin Ocean - EDITO-Model Lab
project.keywords: Ocean modelling, Downscaling from Global Ocean to coastal, What-il scenarios, Artificial Intelligence, Emulators, Hybrid models, Virtual Research Environment

article.title: New tool to develop ocean management scenarios

OceanBench: The Sea Surface Height Edition

details.authors: Johnson, J. Emmanuel; Febvre, Quentin; Gorbunova, Anastasia; Metref, Sammy; Ballarotta, Maxime; Sommer, Julien Le; Fablet, Ronan

result.title: EDITO-MODEL LAB: the next generation of numerical models for the European Digital Twin Ocean

details.journalTitle: Proceedings of the 10th EuroGOOS International Conference

result.title: Strategic Plan
result.description: This deliverable presents the strategic plan including co design of the components, HPC resources and infrastructures. It describes the design of each component that will be developed during EDITO-Model Lab project. Several sections will be included, based on the project WP organisation 1) Design the integration path for the core model suite. 2) Design of the Virtual Environment. 3) design of the Focus Application. 4) Design of the What-if scenarios. Other sections will describe HPC resources and infrastructure needed for the implementation of the DTO core model suite. This document will be produced in T1.1 with contribution from T4.1, T5.1, T6.1, T7.1,T7.2 and T7.3

result.title: Virtual Ocean Model Lab
result.description: Software documentation of the Virtual Ocean Model Lab (VOML) developed in WP5, including the backend solution (T5.2), co-development capacity (T5.3.1), the relocatable modelling platforms (T5.3.2) and the user interfaces (T5.4).

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - EDITO-Model Lab (Underlying models for the European DIgital Twin Ocean - EDITO-Model Lab)
result.teaser: EDITO-Model Lab is a Horizon Europe project working to develop the next generation of ocean numerical models to be integrated into the EU public infrastructure of the European Digital Twin of the Ocean, providing access to focus applications (FA) and simulations of what-if...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Plan for Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation of results
result.description: Communication plan for the project, describing the main communication goals, key messages to be conveyed, target audiences, means and channels, KPIs, monitoring procedures, partners’ responsibilities, and calendar. Main content will be about communication and dissemination. Exploitation of results will also be addressed. It will be developed in Tasks T8.1 and T8.3.

result.title: Interannual sea level variability in the North and Baltic seas and net flux through the Danish straits

details.authors: Nam Thanh Pham, Joanna Staneva, Antonio Bonaduce, Emil V. Stanev, Sebastian Grayek

result.title: Website
result.description: This deliverable presents the website of EDITO-Model Lab project. The website will be the central point of all digital communications and will act as a showroom to be populated with info on the main themes addressed by the project, its relevance in today’s society and how will the project add value and provide solutions to the associated issues. It will also serve as a repository of news and various communication materials on the project’s progress and results, providing details on the consortium as well. This project will be produced under Task 8.1.

result.title: Sea state contributions to thermosteric sea-level in high-resolution ocean-wave coupled simulations

details.authors: Antonio Bonaduce, Nam Thanh Pham, Joanna Staneva, Sebastian Grayek, Roshin P. Raj, Øyvind Breivik

result.title: Data Management Plan - first version
result.description: The first version of the DMP describes the preliminary plan for the cycle for the data to be collected, processed and/or generated by EDITO-Model Lab, including the description of the management procedure, storage infrastructures and standards that will be used during the project. This document will be produced in T1.1.

result.title: EDITO-Model Lab technical architecture
result.description: Description of the technical architecture for the Virtual Ocean Model Lab (VOML), supported by Autosubmit as backend solution, integrated with the collaborative development and testing framework and the relocatable Ocean modelling platform, and including the user interfaces for demand model. This will be a co-design task developed in WP5, T5.1, and will be coupled to the VRE portal that will be provided as part of the EU public DTO platform.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
